CHAPTER 803
Registration of Businesses
803.01   Registration required.
803.02   Definitions.
803.03   Purpose.
803.04   Business registration fee.
803.05   Date and method of registration.
803.06   Exemptions; charitable organizations.
803.07   False applications unlawful.
803.08   Administration.
803.09   Appeals.
803.10   Delinquent payment.
803.11   Compliance with other legislation.
803.12   Nonexclusive remedies.
803.99   Penalty.
803.01 REGISTRATION REQUIRED.
   Every person or business engaged or intending to engage in any calling,
business, occupation or profession by maintaining a business location, in whole
or in part, within the limits of the City of Johnstown, Cambria County,
Pennsylvania, is required to register and pay an annual business registration
fee for the privilege of doing business in the City.
(Ord. 5347. Passed 12-14-22.)
803.02 DEFINITIONS.
   The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this ordinance, shall
have the meaning and be defined as set forth below:
   (a)   “Business.” A calling, occupation, profession, or activity engaged in
with the object of gain, benefit or advantage, either directly or indirectly.
"Business" shall include charitable organizations and organizations performing
a charitable purpose.
   (b)   “Charitable organization.” An organization that is determined by the
Internal Revenue Service to be exempt from federal income taxes under 26 U.S.C.
§501(c)(3), (4), (6), (7), (8), (10) or (19).
   (c)   “Charitable purpose.” A benevolent, philanthropic, patriotic, or
eleemosynary purpose which does not result in personal gain to a sponsor,
organizer, officer, director, trustee or person with ultimate control of the
organization.
   (d)   “City.” The City of Johnstown, Cambria County, Pennsylvania.
   (e)   “Person.” Any individual, firm, partnership, LLP, LLC, cooperative
nonprofit membership, corporation, joint venture, association, estate, trust,
business trust, receiver, syndicate, holding company, or other group or
combination acting as a unit, in the singular or plural, and the agent or
employee having charge or control of a business in the absence of the
principal.
   (f)   “Official Registration Department.” For the purposes of this chapter,
the Official Registration Department of the City is the Finance Department of
the City of Johnstown.
(Ord. 5347. Passed 12-14-22.)
803.03 PURPOSE.
   The business registration required by this chapter is for the purpose of
establishing a database of businesses operating within the City.
(Ord. 5347. Passed 12-14-22.)
803.04 BUSINESS REGISTRATION FEE.
   (a)   The required business registration as established from time to time by
City Council shall be paid for each business subject hereto upon the adoption
of this chapter, at the time a person opens a business in the City of
Johnstown, upon the change of ownership of a business located in the City of
Johnstown, or upon the change of location of a business within the City of
Johnstown. This fee may be amended from time to time by resolution of the City
Council.
   (b)   A separate registration shall be required for each place of business
and for each business conducted at one address. The registration fee will not
be prorated if a business is registered during the year. No refund shall be
made for a business that is discontinued. Businesses operating within the City
on the date this chapter becomes effective may submit a single registration
form listing the address of each business operating under the same corporate
name.
   (c)   The City will waive the initial business registration fee for all
businesses operating within the City on the date this chapter becomes
effective, until such time as a change of location or change of ownership of
the business occurs, however registration for said businesses is still required
as of the relevant effective date. Upon either occurrence, the relevant fee
will be required to file a corrected business registration form.
(Ord. 5347. Passed 12-14-22.)
803.05 DATE AND METHOD OF REGISTRATION.
   (a)   The owner, agent or legal representative of each business subject to
this chapter shall register the business within 15 days of opening a business,
of an ownership change of an existing business, or a location change of an
existing business subject to this chapter.
   (b)   Registration shall be on the form attached to Ordinance No. 5347, as
may be modified from time to time by resolution of City Council, which shall
contain the last five digits of the social security number and/or the full
federal employer identification number (FEIN) for those businesses located
within the City, the business name as reported on the business's or owner's
Pennsylvania income tax return, and all information about the applicant and the
business deemed necessary for the City to accomplish the purposes set forth
above.
   (c)   All businesses shall be required to annually report to the Official
Registration Department that information provided on the initial business
registration form filed with the City remains accurate. Notices will be issued
annually by the Official Registration Department to all businesses registered
to confirm the information. Confirmations are due by January 31 of each year.
(Ord. 5347. Passed 12-14-22.)
803.06 EXEMPTIONS; CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS.
   (a)   No person or business shall be exempt from the requirements of the
chapter by reason of the lack of an established place of business within the
City, unless exempted by state or federal law. No person or business shall be
exempt from this chapter by reason of the payment of any other registration or
license fee, unless exempted by state law, and no person shall be relieved of
liability for payment of any other tax or fee by reason of application of this
chapter.
   (b)   A charitable organization shall be deemed a business subject to this
chapter and the business registration fee.
   (c)   Units of federal, state, county or City government, including the
School District of Johnstown, located within the City of Johnstown, are exempt
from the requirements of this chapter.
(Ord. 5347. Passed 12-14-22.)
803.07 FALSE APPLICATIONS UNLAWFUL.
   It shall be unlawful for any person or business subject to the provisions of
this chapter to submit a false registration for a business or to give or file,
or direct the giving or filing of, any false information with respect to the
registration required by this chapter.
(Ord. 5347. Passed 12-14-22.)
803.08 ADMINISTRATION.
   The Official Registration Department shall administer the provisions of this
chapter, administrate registrations, make or initiate investigations to ensure
compliance, report violations to the City Solicitor, assist in prosecution of
violators, produce forms, make reasonable regulations relating to the
administration of this chapter, and perform such other duties as may be duly
assigned.
(Ord. 5347. Passed 12-14-22.)
803.09 APPEALS.
   (a)   If a person or business fails to register a business or to furnish the
information required by this chapter to the Official Registration Department,
the Official Registration Department shall examine such records of the business
or any other available records as may be appropriate and conduct such
investigations and statistical surveys as the Official Registration Department
may deem appropriate to assess any penalties as provided herein.
   (b)   Any findings or penalties resulting from an inspection or
investigation may be appealed to the City Manager, or his/her designee, by
filing a written notice of appeal within ten days after the day of written
notification to the person or business. The City Manager and/or designee will
review the matter and provide a written response regarding such appeal to the
person or business filing regarding the final disposition of said matter.
(Ord. 5347. Passed 12-14-22.)
803.10 DELINQUENT PAYMENT.
   For nonpayment of all or any part of the business registration fee, the
Official Registration Department shall levy and collect a late penalty of 5% of
the fee for each month or portion thereof after the due date until paid.
Penalties shall not be waived. If any fee remains unpaid for sixty days after
its due date, the Official Registration Department shall report it to the City
Solicitor for appropriate legal action.
(Ord. 5347. Passed 12-14-22.)
803.11 COMPLIANCE WITH OTHER LEGISLATION.
   In no instance shall the registration of a business and the payment of
registration fees be construed to exonerate the owner, local agent or other
responsible party from responsibility for compliance with any other City of
Johnstown code or ordinance.
(Ord. 5347. Passed 12-14-22.)
803.12 NONEXCLUSIVE REMEDIES.
   The penalty and collection provisions of this chapter shall be independent,
non mutually exclusive separate remedies, all of which shall be available to
the City as may be deemed appropriate for carrying out the proposes of this
chapter. The remedies and procedures provided in this chapter for violation
hereof are not intended to supplant or replace to any degree the remedies and
procedures available to the City in the case of a violation of any other City
of Johnstown code or ordinance, whether or not such other code or ordinance is
referenced in this chapter, and whether or not an ongoing violation of such
other code or ordinance is cited as the underlying ground for a finding of a
violation of this chapter.
(Ord. 5347. Passed 12-14-22.)
803.99 PENALTY.
   Any person violating any provision of this chapter shall be deemed guilty of
an offense and shall be subject to a fine of up to $100 upon conviction. Each
month of violation shall be considered a separate offense. Punishment for
violation shall not relieve the offender of liability for fees, penalties and
costs provided for herein. In addition, the City may pursue any of the remedies
available to it in law or in equity to mandate compliance with the terms
hereof.
(Ord. 5347. Passed 12-14-22.)
CHAPTER 804
Mechanical Amusement Devices
804.01   Short title.
804.02   Definitions.
804.03   License required.
804.04   Application for license.
804.05   Persons ineligible for licenses.
804.06   Conditions for issuance.
804.07   Construction of provisions.
804.08   License fees/tax.
804.09   Issuance and display of license.
804.10   Inspection.
804.11   Revocation, debarment and contraband declaration.
804.01 SHORT TITLE.
   This Chapter shall be known as the "Mechanical Amusement Device Ordinance."
(Ord. 5351. Passed 5-10-23.)
804.02 DEFINITIONS.
   Unless the context clearly indicates otherwise, the following words and
phrases, used in this Part or in an application for license of amusement
devices, shall have the meaning given to them in this section:
   (a)   “Amusement device” means any mechanical, electronic, and/or video
amusement device, jukebox, or pool table and/or other electronic device,
machine or apparatus whatsoever, which, upon the insertion of a coin, slug,
token, plate, disc or key into any slot, crevice or other opening, or by the
payment of any price (via the internet, app, mobile device or in person), may
be operated or used as a game, skill game, entertainment or amusement, whether
or not registering a score and whether or not a prize or payment is offered.
   (b)   “Applicant” means any individual, partnership, corporation,
unincorporated enterprise owned by two or more persons, limited liability
company, trust or other business entity, domestic or foreign, required to seek
and/or who is seeking to obtain a license for an amusement device under this
Part.
   (c)   “Application for license of amusement devices” means the document
filed by an applicant requesting a permit to possess in the City of Johnstown
any video or mechanical amusement device, jukebox, or pool table and/or other
electronic device, machine, or apparatus whatsoever, for the playing of games
and amusement.
   (d)   “Business establishment” means any restaurant, bar, tavern, retail,
manufacturing, wholesale, institutional, educational, religious, governmental,
or other nonresidential establishment, store or business, whether or not in
operation.
   (e)   “Gambling device” means any device, machine, or apparatus used for the
playing of poker, blackjack, keno, bingo, or other casino games by the
insertion therein of any coin, currency, metal disc, slug, or token, or by the
payment of any price (via the internet, app, mobile device or in person).
   (f)   “Illegal gambling device” means any device, machine, or apparatus
designed and/or specifically equipped to be used for the playing of poker,
blackjack, keno, bingo, slots, or other casino gambling games by the insertion
therein of any coin, currency, metal disc, slug, or token, which has, or is
designed to facilitate the ready use of, a knock off or knockdown device or
other capability for erasing or eliminating accumulated playing credits.
   (g)   “Jukebox” means any device, machine, or apparatus which plays recorded
music, whether by record, tape, compact disc, or other means, by the insertion
therein of any coin, currency, metal disc, slug, or token, or by the payment of
any price (via the internet, app, mobile device or in person).
   (h)   “Pool table” means any device or apparatus upon which is played the
games of eight-ball, billiards, pool, snooker, or other similar games for which
a fee is charged, whether or not such device is operated through the insertion
of coin, currency, metal disc, slug, or token, or by the payment of any price
(via the internet, app, mobile device or in person).
   (i)   “Proprietor” means any individual, partnership, or corporation who
owns, leases, or maintains the business establishment in which any jukebox,
pool table, or video or mechanical amusement device is placed for the use,
patronage, recreation, or amusement of the public or of persons in or about the
business establishment.
   (j)   “Vendor” means any individual, partnership, corporation,
unincorporated enterprise owned by two or more persons, limited liability
company, trust or other business entity, domestic or foreign, who is the lawful
owner of any jukebox, pool table, or video or mechanical amusement device for
which a license is sought under this Chapter, or any individual, partnership,
or corporation who makes, assembles, sets up, maintains, sells, lends, leases,
gives away, or offers for sale, loan, lease, or gift, any jukebox, pool table,
or video or mechanical amusement device for which a license is sought under the
Part.
   (k)   “Video or mechanical amusement device” means any device, machine, or
apparatus used for the playing of games or otherwise used for the purpose of
amusement or entertainment by the insertion therein of any coin, currency,
metal disc, slug, or token, or payment via the internet, app, or in person,
including, but not limited to, "claw machines," "electric or electronic dart
boards," "gambling devices," "pinball machines," "skill games" and "video
games."
(Ord. 5351. Passed 5-10-23.)
804.03 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No individual, partnership, corporation, unincorporated enterprise owned by
two or more persons, limited liability company, trust or other business entity,
domestic or foreign, shall at any time have in his/their possession within the
City of Johnstown any video or mechanical amusement device, jukebox or pool
table for the playing of games and amusement without first having procured a
license and paying a license fee or tax therefor as hereinafter provided in
this Chapter.
(Ord. 5351. Passed 5-10-23.)
804.04 APPLICATION FOR LICENSE.
   Any Applicant, as defined herein, desiring to procure a license as required
in Section
804.03, shall apply therefor in writing to the City of Johnstown Finance
Director. Said application shall require information including, but not limited
to, the following with the regard to the applicant, proprietor, and/or vendor,
as appropriate:
   (a)   The application status (new or renewal license).
   (b)   The type of business.
   (c)   Business information including but not limited to the name of the
business, the mailing address and location of the business, phone number, email
address and business contact information.
   (d)   A list of the type and number of mechanical devices as well as the
vendor.
(Ord. 5351. Passed 5-10-23.)
804.05 PERSONS INELIGIBLE FOR LICENSES.
   The City of Johnstown Finance Director shall not issue a license for any
video or mechanical amusement device to any person who:
   (a)   Is not 21 years of age;
   (b)   Has been found guilty of or accepted accelerated rehabilitative
disposition for possessing or using a video or mechanical amusement device in
violation of the Crimes Code of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, 18 Pa.C.S.A.
§ 101 et seq., within three years of the date of the application.
(Ord. 5351. Passed 5-10-23.)
804.06 CONDITIONS FOR ISSUANCE.
   The grant of a license applied for under this Chapter shall be subject to
the following conditions, in addition to the payment of fees as further
addressed herein:
   (a)   No license shall be granted until a period of ten days shall have
elapsed from the date of application during which time the City of Johnstown
Finance Director may, at his or her discretion, investigate the facts set forth
in the application.
   (b)   The City of Johnstown Finance Director shall refuse to issue a license
for any device that the applicant has not affirmed the fact that it is not
designed, or intended to be used, for gambling purposes.
   (c)   A license shall not be issued unless/until the applicant acknowledges:
      (1)   That obtaining or displaying a City of Johnstown license does not
sanction or permit the use of any device for gambling purposes or possession of
an illegal gambling device, either per se, or as modified; and
      (2)   That if the applicant or licensee illegally uses or possesses an
unlawful gambling device, either per se or as modified, he or she may be
prosecuted by the City of Johnstown or other law enforcement officials.
(Ord. 5351. Passed 5-10-23.)
804.07 CONSTRUCTION OF PROVISIONS.
   Nothing in this Part shall be construed to authorize, license, or permit any
gambling devices whatsoever, or any mechanism that has been judicially
determined to be a gambling device, either per se or as modified, or in any way
contrary to law, or that may be contrary to any future laws of the Commonwealth
of Pennsylvania or the United States of America.
(Ord. 5351. Passed 5-10-23.)
804.08 LICENSE FEES/TAX.
   No license shall be issued until the following annual fees shall have been
paid by the applicant to the City of Johnstown for each and every device to be
installed or used: Establish Fee to be amended time to time by resolution.
   (a)   Jukebox. Annual fee established at one hundred dollars ($100.00) per
machine and thereafter updated in the City Schedule of Fees by a Resolution of
the City Council of the City of Johnstown.
   (b)   Pool table. Annual fee established at seventy-five dollars ($75.00)
per table, and thereafter updated in the City Schedule of Fees by a Resolution
of the City Council of the City of Johnstown.
   (c)   Video, skill or mechanical amusement device.
      (1)   Non paying device. Annual fee established at one hundred dollars
($100.00), and thereafter updated in the City Schedule of Fees by a Resolution
of the City Council of the City of Johnstown.
      (2)   Gambling and skill devices. Annual fee established at three hundred
fifty ($350.00), and thereafter updated in the Schedule of Fees by a Resolution
of the City Council of the City of Johnstown.
(Ord. 5351. Passed 5-10-23.)
804.09 ISSUANCE AND DISPLAY OF LICENSE.
   Upon the payment of the license fee provided by this Part, and upon a
determination that the application fully complies with this Part, the City of
Johnstown Finance Director shall issue a disc, plate, sticker, or other
affixable emblem setting forth the number of the license for each machine so
licensed, and said disc, plate, sticker, or other affixable emblem shall be
attached and fastened to the respective machine or device so that the same may
be clearly observable and readable. Discs, plates, stickers, or other affixable
emblems issued for a particular machine or device are not transferable to
another machine or device. All discs, plates, stickers or other affixable
emblems issued by the City of Johnstown for video and mechanical amusement
devices shall state that the video or mechanical amusement device is for
amusement purposes only, that it is not a gambling device and that only games
and not money may be won on the machine or device.
(Ord. 5351. Passed 5-10-23.)
804.10 INSPECTION.
   The City of Johnstown or its agents may, during regular business hours,
conduct inspections of any business establishment where any video or mechanical
amusement device, jukebox, or pool table licensed under this Part is located,
installed, placed, or used, to ensure compliance with this Part.
(Ord. 5351. Passed 5-10-23.)
804.11 REVOCATION, DEBARMENT AND CONTRABAND DECLARATION.
   (a)   In the event any applicant, vendor, or proprietor falsifies any
information on an application for license of amusement devices, or violates
this Part, the City of Johnstown shall immediately revoke all licenses issued
under this Part to such applicant, vendor or proprietor.
   (b)   Moreover, in the event an applicant, vendor of a video or mechanical
amusement device or a proprietor of a business establishment is convicted of
possessing or using a video or mechanical amusement device in violation of the
Crimes Code of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, 18 Pa.C.S.A. § 101 et seq.,
the City of Johnstown shall revoke each license issued to such person, as an
applicant, vendor, or proprietor.
   (c)   Additionally, the City of Johnstown shall not issue a license of
amusement devices to any person who has been found guilty of or accepted
accelerated rehabilitative disposition, for possessing or using a video or
mechanical amusement device in violation of the Crimes Code of the Commonwealth
of Pennsylvania, 18 Pa.C.S.A. § 101 et seq., within three years of the date of
application.
   (d)   Any video or mechanical amusement device used or possessed in
violation of the Crimes Code of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, 18 Pa.C.S.A.
§ 101 et seq., or this Part, may be deemed contraband and forfeited in
accordance with the provisions set forth in 18 Pa.C.S.A. § 6501(d) (relating to
scattering rubbish).
(Ord. 5351. Passed 5-10-23.)
CHAPTER 806
Cabarets
806.01   Cabaret defined.
806.02   Exhibitions and entertainment; license required.
806.03   Application for license.
806.04   Waiting period for license; written protest; refusal of issuance.
806.05   Issuance of license; hours of entertainment; minimum age of
entertainers.
806.06   License fee.
806.07   Expiration and renewal of license.
806.08   Exhibition deemed immoral by Police Department; revocation of license.
806.99   Penalty.
   CROSS REFERENCES
   Sex offenses - see Crimes Code §§ 3101 et seq.
   Open lewdness - see Crimes Code § 5901
   Prostitution and related offenses - see Crimes Code § 5902
   Obscene and other sexual materials - see Crimes Code § 5903
   Alcoholic beverages - see GEN. OFF.
Ch. 610
   Peace disturbances - see GEN. OFF.
Ch. 658
   Sex related offenses - see GEN. OFF.
Ch. 670
   Sexually oriented businesses - see B.R. & T.
Ch. 840
806.01 CABARET DEFINED.
   "Cabaret," as used in this chapter, shall be deemed to include all places,
regularly and habitually operated for profit, where food and beverages are sold
or brought into the premises by patrons for consumption on the premises, and
where one or more forms of entertainment are permitted or provided for the
patrons thereof. However, nothing herein contained shall be construed to apply
to bona fide clubs, fraternal orders, societies and churches conducting dances
and other entertainment where admission is restricted to members of such clubs,
order or societies and their families, whether held on their own premises or in
a hall leased or donated for the purpose.
(Ord. 4526. Passed 2-28-90.)
806.02 EXHIBITIONS AND ENTERTAINMENT; LICENSE REQUIRED.
   From and after the enactment of this chapter, it shall be unlawful for any
person or persons, firm or corporation, managing or conducting a cabaret within
the limits of the City, to put on or cause to be put on or given any floor
show, dancing, singing, orchestral, phonographic or radio concerts or other
exhibitions or forms of public entertainment, without first obtaining a license
to do so from the City.
(Ord. 4526. Passed 2-28-90.)
806.03 APPLICATION FOR LICENSE.
   Every person, firm or corporation owning, managing or conducting any cabaret
within the limits of the City, before putting on or giving any floor show,
dancing, singing, orchestral, phonographic or radio concerts or other
exhibitions or forms of public entertainment, shall make written application to
the Director/Chief of Police for a license to conduct the same, specifying the
name of the owner or owners of the cabaret, the person or persons in charge
thereof and responsible for the conduct and operation of the same, and the
place at which the cabaret is located, and agreeing to comply with the
provisions and conditions of this chapter.
   Said application shall be accompanied by a certificate from the Building
Inspector that the building in which it is proposed to maintain such cabaret
has been constructed and maintained in accordance with the laws of the State
and the ordinances and regulations of the City governing erection, maintenance
and construction of buildings which are to be used for such purposes.
   The applicant shall also show to the satisfaction of the Director/Chief of
Police, by letters from at least three businessmen or property owners in the
neighborhood, that he or she is of good moral character.
(Ord. 4526. Passed 2-28-90.)
806.04 WAITING PERIOD FOR LICENSE; WRITTEN PROTEST; REFUSAL OF ISSUANCE.
   No cabaret license shall be issued for at least seven days from the date of
the receipt of the application therefor. If, within said period of seven days,
a written protest against the issuance of such license is filed with the City
Manager by a majority of the owners or occupants of structures located within
300 feet of any point on the property line of the property in which a cabaret
is proposed to be established and maintained, and if he or she finds, upon
investigation, that the establishment and maintenance of such cabaret will
constitute a disturbance to the peace and quiet of the neighborhood within such
300 feet, or will be injurious or harmful to the morals of the children or
people attending any church, hospital, school or public library within such 300
feet, the Director/Chief of Police shall refuse to issue such license.
(Ord. 4526. Passed 2-28-90.)
806.05 ISSUANCE OF LICENSE; HOURS OF ENTERTAINMENT; MINIMUM AGE OF
ENTERTAINERS.
   The Director/Chief of Police, if satisfied that the applicant for a cabaret
license is of good moral character and has complied with all the conditions and
requirements of this chapter, may issue such license upon the applicant paying
to the Director of Finance the usual license fee, which shall go into the
General Fund of the City. However, after the granting of such license, as
herein provided for, it shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation
to conduct any floor show, dancing, singing, orchestral, phonographic or radio
concerts or other exhibitions or forms of public entertainment, after the hour
of 2:00 a.m., in any cabaret within the limits of the City. Further, it shall
be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation owning, managing or conducting
a cabaret within the City to employ, hire, procure or permit any person, male
or female, under the age of eighteen years, to appear in or take part as a
performer or entertainer (except as a member of an orchestra) in any floor
show, dancing or other exhibition or form of public entertainment provided in
such cabaret for its patrons.
(Ord. 4670. Passed 7-13-94.)
806.06 LICENSE FEE.
   Business operating a cabaret shall obtain a business license from the
Department of Finance and pay an annual license fee. The fee shall be
established by ordinance of City Council and amended from time to time. The fee
shall be in addition to all other license fees or taxes required to be paid by
the laws of the State or the ordinances of the City and shall not be
apportioned for any part of any year.
(Ord. 4698. Passed 12-21-94; Ord. 5353. Passed 5-31-23.)
806.07 EXPIRATION AND RENEWAL OF LICENSE.
   All licenses issued under this chapter shall expire on the thirty-first day
of December of the calendar year in which they are issued, but may be renewed
from year to year upon payment of the annual license fee.
(Ord. 4526. Passed 2-28-90.)
806.08 EXHIBITION DEEMED IMMORAL BY POLICE DEPARTMENT; REVOCATION OF LICENSE.
   The Director/Chief of Police and members of the Police Department of the
City shall at all times have access to cabarets, and if at any time the
Director/Chief of Police finds that there has been any exhibition of indecent
or immoral character, and that the future maintenance of such cabaret is
injurious to the public welfare or morals, or is a disturbance to the peace and
quiet of a neighborhood within 300 feet of the property of such cabaret, he or
she shall revoke the license of the cabaret without refund.
(Ord. 4526. Passed 2-28-90.)
806.99 PENALTY.
   Any person, society, club, organization or corporation who or which violates
any provision of this chapter shall be fined not less than twenty-five dollars
($25.00) nor more than three hundred dollars ($300.00) and costs of
prosecution, and, in default of the payment of said fines and costs, shall be
imprisoned in the County Prison for a period not exceeding thirty days.
(Ord. 4526. Passed 2-7-90.)

procedures and requirements relating to cable franchises in the City. Copies of

There are no sections in
Chapter 807. This chapter has been established to provide a place for cross
references and any future legislation.

CHAPTER 808
Dances and Dance Halls
808.01   Definitions.
808.02   Permit required for public dances and balls.
808.03   Licensing of dance halls and ballrooms; fees; term.
808.04   Investigation of license applicants.
808.05   Compliance with applicable laws.
808.06   Disorderly or immoral conduct.
808.07   Sanitation and safety.
808.08   Inspection by Department of Police; authority to vacate.
808.09   Attendance of minors.
808.10   Closing hours.
 
808.99   Penalty.
   CROSS REFERENCES
   Public dances and dance halls - see 3rd Class §§n2630 et seq.
   Business privilege tax - see B.R. & T.
Ch. 872
   Mercantile license tax - see B.R. & T.
Ch. 880
808.01 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter:
   (a)   "Public dance" and "public ball" mean and include any dance or ball
conducted in connection with instruction in dancing for hire, and any dance or
ball to which admission may be had by the payment of a fee or by the purchase,
possession or presentation of a ticket or token, or in connection with which a
charge is made for caring for clothing or other property, and any dance or ball
to which the public generally may gain admission with or without the payment of
a fee.
   (b)   "Dance hall" and "ballroom" mean and include any room, place or space
in which a public dance or public ball is held and any room, hall or academy in
which classes in dancing are held and instruction in dancing is given for hire.
(Ord. 745. Passed 7-15-19.)
808.02 PERMIT REQUIRED FOR PUBLIC DANCES AND BALLS.
   No person shall hold a public dance or public ball in the City without first
obtaining a permit therefor from the City Manager; however, a permit shall not
be required for dances held and conducted by regularly established dancing
instructors in connection with such instruction.
   The fee shall be established by ordinance of City Council and amended from
time to time.
(Ord. 4670. Passed 7-13-94; Ord. 5353. Passed 5-31-23.)
808.03 LICENSING OF DANCE HALLS AND BALLROOMS; FEES; TERM.
   (a)   No person shall hold or conduct any public dance or public ball, or
hold or conduct classes in dancing, or give instructions in dancing for hire,
in any dance hall or ballroom in the City, unless such dance hall or ballroom
has been duly licensed for such purpose. (Ord. 4390. Passed 9-10-86.)
   (b)   An application for such a license shall be made by the proprietor of
such dance hall or ballroom to the City Manager, who is hereby authorized to
issue the same. (Ord. 4670. Passed 7-13-94.)
   (c)   The fee payable for each annual license granted shall be established
by ordinance of City Council and amended from time to time.
   (d)   Each license granted hereunder shall expire on June 1 of each year.
   (e)   The fee payable for each license granted hereunder shall be for the
whole or any portion of a calendar year, and all moneys received by way of
license fees hereunder shall be paid into the General Fund of the City.
   (f)   Every licensed public dance hall or ballroom shall post its license in
a conspicuous place within such dance hall or ballroom.
(Ord. 4390. Passed 9-10-86; Ord. 5353. Passed 5-31-23.)
808.04 INVESTIGATION OF LICENSE APPLICANTS.
   It shall be the duty of the City Manager to cause an investigation to be
made of all applicants for public dance hall or ballroom licenses to determine
whether or not the dance hall or ballroom sought to be licensed complies with
the rules, regulations, ordinances and laws applicable thereto. In making such
an investigation, the City Manager shall, when desired, have the assistance of
any City department.
(Ord. 4670. Passed 7-13-94.)
808.05 COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE LAWS.
   No license for a public dance hall or ballroom shall be issued until it is
ascertained that the location for which it is issued complies with all
applicable laws, ordinances, rules and regulations applicable thereto, is a
safe and proper place for the purpose for which it is to be used, is properly
ventilated and is supplied with sufficient toilet facilities.
(Ord. 745. Passed 7-15-19.)
808.06 DISORDERLY OR IMMORAL CONDUCT.
   The license of any public dance hall or ballroom may be forfeited or revoked
by the City Manager for disorderly or immoral conduct on the premises, or upon
proof that the dance hall or ballroom was frequented by disorderly or immoral
persons, or for a violation of any of the rules, regulations, ordinances and
laws governing or applying to public dances, dance halls or ballrooms. If, at
any time, the license of a public dance hall or ballroom is forfeited or
revoked, at least three months shall elapse before another license or permit is
granted for dancing on the same premises.
(Ord. 4670. Passed 7-13-94.)
808.07 SANITATION AND SAFETY.
   All public dance halls or ballrooms shall be kept at all times in a clean,
healthful and sanitary condition, and all stairways and other passages and all
rooms connected with the public dance hall or ballroom shall be kept open and
well lighted.
(Ord. 745. Passed 7-15-19.)
808.08 INSPECTION BY DEPARTMENT OF POLICE; AUTHORITY TO VACATE.
   All public dance halls and ballrooms shall be subject to inspection by the
Department of Police at all reasonable times and whenever they are open for
dancing, instruction in dancing or any other purpose.
   Any police officer shall have the power to cause a public dance hall or
ballroom to be vacated whenever any law, ordinance, rule or regulation relating
to public dances and public balls is being violated or whenever any indecent
act is committed therein, or whenever any disorder of a gross, violent or
vulgar character takes place therein.
(Ord. 745. Passed 7-15-19.)
808.09 ATTENDANCE OF MINORS.
   No person shall permit any minor under the age of sixteen years to attend or
take part in any public dance after 9:00 p.m.
(Ord. 745. Passed 7-15-19.)
808.10 CLOSING HOURS.
   All public dances shall be discontinued, and all public dance halls and
ballrooms shall be closed, on or before 1:00 a.m. However, upon the application
of a bona fide organization or society, and upon an investigation by the proper
authority, the City Manager may grant such organization or society a permit to
continue a dance until 2:00 a.m.
(Ord. 4670. Passed 7-13-94.)
808.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
202.99 for general Code penalty if no specific penalty is provided.)
CHAPTER 832
Parking Lots

   CROSS REFERENCES
   Acquisition of parking lots - see 3rd Class § 2403(54)
   Licensing of parking lots operated for profit - see 3rd Class § 2650
   Johnstown Parking Authority - see ADM.

   Bureau of Parking - see TRAF.
Ch. 480
   Parking in entrances and exits of parking lots - see TRAF.
482.13
   Parking generally - see TRAF.
Ch. 482
   Parking meters - see TRAF.
Ch. 484
   Penalties and interest for delinquent taxes - see B.R. & T.
